column10: Everything u need is in Shrilanka
column12: What a beautiful place! The modern decor and incredible staff made our stay wonderful. The property is clean, the pool is lovely, and the food is amazing. We wish we could have stayed longer. The view is simply incredible, offering a calm and peaceful atmosphere. We will definitely return for a longer stay.

column6: {'id': '12924646', 'name': 'Regenta Arie Lagoon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 460, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.168803, 'longitude': 79.82558, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d12924646-Reviews-Regenta_Arie_Lagoon-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.royalorchidhotels.com/regenta-arie-lagoon-negombo-sri-lanka/overview', 'address': '587 Pamunugama Road, Thalahena,, Negombo 22100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '587 Pamunugama Road, Thalahena,', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 19, 'count2': 18, 'count3': 46, 'count4': 112, 'count5': 266}}
column12:
We stayed here in March and had a lovely stay. Stayed here the day before we left to the airport. We were happy with our decision to stay here as it was close to the airport and we had no issues getting there in the morning.

The booking process was easy and quick via email. Very good and prompt communication throughout. 

Checking in was quick and easy too.  The welcome drink was quite warm and we would have preferred something nice and cool :)

Rooms were nice and clean. Had all the amenities. Had a nice , relaxed vibe throughout.

Staff were lovely , friendly and helpful. They had buggies to transport the luggage which was nice and I was able to get a ride to and from to the room with my little baby too:)

We had booked a room with a pool which was brilliant.  It was, however, slightly loud at night which may have been the motors or generators , not sure what it was but they were next to our room.

Overall, we had a nice time and we would definitely stay here again.
column13: We had a nice and comfortable stay :)

column6: {'id': '12924646', 'name': 'Regenta Arie Lagoon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 460, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.168803, 'longitude': 79.82558, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d12924646-Reviews-Regenta_Arie_Lagoon-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.royalorchidhotels.com/regenta-arie-lagoon-negombo-sri-lanka/overview', 'address': '587 Pamunugama Road, Thalahena,, Negombo 22100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '587 Pamunugama Road, Thalahena,', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 19, 'count2': 18, 'count3': 46, 'count4': 112, 'count5': 266}}
column12:
We stayed for 3 nights at the end of our trip around Sri Lanka. The check-in process (at around 6 pm) was welcoming, although I think it's weird to be asked to pay for our rooms during check-in. 

Our room was great. Fantastic air-con and a really comfortable bed. We appreciated the cake to help us celebrate our anniversary. Thank you. 

Although we had a good time,  it could've been great. The main pool was closed until our last day. There was never any pool towels, we always had to ask, then wait up to 30 minutes to get a towel and sunbed mattress in the morning. The pool is advertised as being open from 7am, but it clearly isn't. 

We had dinner in the restaurant 2 out of our 3 nights, both times due to convenience (1st night, just arrived after a very long day travelling and 3rd night, when it was pouring down). The food was OK, for the price, it could've been better. 

Finally, breakfast. Very disappointing. Only having runny scrambled eggs as an option isn't great. When I asked someone in chefs whites for boiled eggs, I was told a flat, 'No'. I asked the maitre d' lady, who initially also told me 'no' before going off and organising me 2 boiled eggs (which were perfect). After almost 3 weeks of travel around Sri Lanka, we were used to the differences in breakfasts, however, this is certainly not a cheap hotel and the least you should expect is a good breakfast with a variety of food items. Needless to say, we only had breakfast here on our first morning, made other arrangements after that. 

I wonder what this hotel is like during the height of the season- it certainly felt like it was closing down and we were a bit of an inconvenience. 

Other people have posted about the events hosted here. There was a corporate event during the middle day of our stay. We were woken before 7am with banging as they put the gazebos up, and again late into the evening when things were taken down, absolute pain. 

All in all we feel disappointed. This was by far the most expensive place we stayed in. It could've been amazing but just left us feeling underwhelmed and disappointed.
column13: Was OK but could've been great

column6: {'id': '12924646', 'name': 'Regenta Arie Lagoon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 460, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.168803, 'longitude': 79.82558, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d12924646-Reviews-Regenta_Arie_Lagoon-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.royalorchidhotels.com/regenta-arie-lagoon-negombo-sri-lanka/overview', 'address': '587 Pamunugama Road, Thalahena,, Negombo 22100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '587 Pamunugama Road, Thalahena,', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 19, 'count2': 18, 'count3': 46, 'count4': 112, 'count5': 266}}

column12: Bit disappointing, was the first place we stayed in SL after a long flight and were disappointed to be kept awake both the nights we were there by a wedding on the first night and a large function the second night. column6: {'id': '12924646', 'name': 'Regenta Arie Lagoon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 460, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.168803, 'longitude': 79.82558, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d12924646-Reviews-Regenta_Arie_Lagoon-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.royalorchidhotels.com/regenta-arie-lagoon-negombo-sri-lanka/overview', 'address': '587 Pamunugama Road, Thalahena,, Negombo 22100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '587 Pamunugama Road, Thalahena,', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 19, 'count2': 18, 'count3': 46, 'count4': 112, 'count5': 266}}
column12:
We stayed here for a one night stopover after our flight from UK. This beautiful hotel is everything you would want from a relaxing stop over and more.
Set in beautiful, immaculate grounds overlooking a lake you immediately feel relaxed and calm. Staff are welcoming, polite and helpful.
There is a lovely infinity pool with plenty of loungers, there are no pool towels so bring your own. 
We stayed in a queen room which was huge, air con, shower everything worked perfectly. The bed was huge and super comfortable.
Food was absolutely wonderful and very cheap. We had typical Sri Lankan curry, the portions were big and the accompaniments made it a fitting feast for our first meal in Sri Lanka. We paid around ¬£20 sterling for our curries, 3 large beers and water. Cocktails were between ¬£5-10. Breakfast was just as fantastic.. full buffet with English/ Sri Lankan choice, fruits/ pastries etc
People gathered round the pool area to swim and chat during the evening when it was all prettily lit. There was a lovely atmosphere 
Everything was so lovely we were sad to leave so quickly but excited for our next adventure. 
If you are planning a stop over near the airport on your trip to Sri Lanka I cannot recommend the aerie lagoon enough.. stay and be enchanted.
column13: Stay and be enchanted at Arie Lagoon

column6: {'id': '12924646', 'name': 'Regenta Arie Lagoon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 460, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.168803, 'longitude': 79.82558, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d12924646-Reviews-Regenta_Arie_Lagoon-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.royalorchidhotels.com/regenta-arie-lagoon-negombo-sri-lanka/overview', 'address': '587 Pamunugama Road, Thalahena,, Negombo 22100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '587 Pamunugama Road, Thalahena,', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 19, 'count2': 18, 'count3': 46, 'count4': 112, 'count5': 266}}
column12:
Stayed here on a Secret Escapes trip. Arrived late in the afternoon. 

Room very big! Seating area and large wardrobe area. Bathroom was huge but had no real roof. Just Mosquito netting so noise came though. 

Bed very comfy. Lots of comfortable pillows. 

Air con was brilliant and very powerful. Only complaint was the industrial size conditioners were loud and could be heard a little from the bed. 

WiFi was good enough to stream Netflix. 

Staff were very helpful 

Food not bad. Standard half board food. 

Safe in room - yes but not fixed to anything. 

Overall very nice but didn‚Äôt make full use of the facilities due to short stay.
column13: Good place on your first / last night in Sri Lanka

column6: {'id': '12924646', 'name': 'Regenta Arie Lagoon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 460, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.168803, 'longitude': 79.82558, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d12924646-Reviews-Regenta_Arie_Lagoon-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.royalorchidhotels.com/regenta-arie-lagoon-negombo-sri-lanka/overview', 'address': '587 Pamunugama Road, Thalahena,, Negombo 22100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '587 Pamunugama Road, Thalahena,', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '22100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 19, 'count2': 18, 'count3': 46, 'count4': 112, 'count5': 266}}
column10: Just go out there and enjoy their hospitality
column12: Oh it‚Äôs a long story of visiting this beautiful Logoon side Resort. We had booked this resort way back in 2021, but Covid2 arrived. We postponed to 2022 but Economy meltdown happened, we booked for 2023 but has to postpone for personal reasons. All this while , the Resort was extremely patient and finally we made it in 2024. Apart from many other Front Office officers, it was ultimately Ms Sachini because of who this trip happened. Thanks to her, and her Manager Mr Muzini Jiffry for their excellent Customer handling. The resort itself is beautifully located on a thin strip of land with the ocean on one side and Negambo lagoon. Well mowed lawns, beautiful rooms, Pool by the Lagoon, Dining hall with Lagoon view. Their F&B department could have no match. Buffet spreads were amazing. Restaurant Manager Mr Ian was so very cooperative, Chef Anurag always served with a smile. Chef Mahesh was the person who created some amazing dishes on our personal request. Shanika the Restaurant Supervisor made sure we ate well and affectionately served us. Our House keeper was also so efficient. She ensured our neat and clean stay. We were also fortunate to meet the Chairman of Regenta Resorts during our stay. He exchanged some good words with us and asked us to visit again. Overall an Out Of The World experience. We‚Äôve decided to visit this Resort again.

column12: Wonderful staff. Great swimming pool. Fantastic buffet breakfast from chef Anura. Lovely welcome from all staff who were friendly and helpful. Fabulous open top bathroom. Worth the journey out to the lagoon for the seclusion and relaxation.

column12: We enjoyed our stay at Arie Lagoon in Negombo.  It was a nice quiet location right on the Lagoon with a beautiful outlook.  The pool was fantastic and the food on offer was varied and delicious.  The property was well maintained and clean and the grounds were spacious.  The rooms were also spacious and clean.  Would stay here again.
column13: Peaceful place to spend the night in Negombo

column12:
The hotel is located in a quiet side street to the beach promenade. We had a friendly, warm welcome with a delicious fruit juice and refreshing towels. The hotel's inner courtyard has a lovely garden with exotic plants. 
The room was spacious, clean and practically equipped. We didn't have any bedsheets to cover ourselves with. Surely we would have been given some if we had asked, but we didn't notice until we went to bed. One criticism: The water in the washbasin and the shower drained away poorly after using.
For dinner and breakfast you can choose from a menu of different dishes, including authentic Sri Lankan food. It was very tasty.
column13: Friendly staff and a beautiful garden in a quiet side street.

column12: The Morning Star Resort had the task of giving us our first impression of Sri Lanka, and boy did it succeed in it! The rooms have airconditioning, clean bathrooms and spaceous beds, and the hotel has a nice swimming pool in which you can relax and cool down after a long hot day. However, above all, the staff is very friendly and the manager is really invested in the hotel. It was also always nice to eat inside the hotel, with a chef who always made sure that everything was perfect, whilst sometimes coming over to have a chitchat! Job really well done!

column10: A lot to explore around the residence.
column12: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights (family of 4). We had an amazing time in the resort, with friendly staff, very good food and a lot of fun at the pool. The rooms where beautiful and the rain-shower was very pleasant. Its near the airport, so perfect after landing. There are some nice restaurants and beautiful streets around the hotel too, so perfect for some exploring.  Overall we are more than happy with the hotel!

column12: A beautiful and peaceful place close to the beach of Negombo. Extremely friendly and hospitable people, and super delicious food. It is a small and cozy accommodation (not a huge tourist complex). If you enjoy personal attention and don't like too much hustle and bustle, this is the place to be. Green garden, comfortabel rooms and a nice swimming pool.

column12:
**Food:**
- The food was delicious and well-prepared.
- There was a good range of options, catering to various tastes.
- The service was prompt and courteous.

**Room:**
- The room was clean and well-maintained.
- The bed was comfortable, and the room had a pleasant ambiance.
- The amenities provided were satisfactory and met our needs.

**Place:**
- The resort is well-located, with easy access to nearby attractions.
- The resort facilities, such as the pool and garden, were enjoyable.
- The overall atmosphere was relaxing and welcoming.

**Staff:**
- The staff were friendly and professional.
- They were attentive to our needs and provided excellent service.
- Their helpfulness and positive attitude greatly enhanced our stay.

Overall
Our stay at Morning Star Resort was excellent. The combination of delicious food, clean and comfortable rooms, and a relaxing atmosphere, along with the attentive and friendly staff, made for a truly enjoyable experience. Highly recommend, and thank you for a wonderful stay!
column13: "Exceptional Stay with Outstanding Service at Morning Star Resort"

I love this budget hotel. It has everything you need for a quick stopover
All your basic necessities under one roof.

column12: Good budget friendly hotel for your first/last day in Sri Lanka. One hour from the airport. Big rooms and good bathroom. Clean, a big bench to put your bags and enough space to put your products in the bathroom. Breakfast is good with fresh juices, fruit, pancakes, eggs, bacon & some Sri Lankan options! Nice pool and beach acces. Some shops outside of the hotel and close to some good restaurants.

column12:
we passed by this location by chance to have a snack!!! 
the place surprised us very much, really welcoming and a swimming pool with sea view, a really nice rooftop bar area!!!! 
We drank a few beers and ate club sandwiches (good) and rice with fried eggs (good)....later we had a pizza with pepperoni (tasty but really really small in size)...
Mr. Vimukthi, a helpful and well-mannered boy, followed us from start to finish!!! 
I would advise the structure to clearly specify the actual amount of taxes to avoid misunderstandings with customers. For the rest I must say that it is very very good!!!

column12: The day out package was wonderful, location is beautiful, quite and the pool was amazing üòç the food was good but maybe add more options for the mains and dessert to the day out package menu might be a plus point. The butter cake offered for tea was absolutely fresh, yummy and soft.

column12: Had a cozy night at Hotel J Negombo and it was a tremendous experience. Food was amazing and Roof top bar was super cool. Affordable prices and room were super comfortable with all amenities. Overall great atmosphere with friendly staff. Recommend to everyone.

column12:
Rooms were elegant,cozy and comfortable.Excellent Pillows and clean bedding..All what is needed was provided.Toilets are clean and with hot water.Meals were tasty and well marinated.Pizza and fish and ships,Kotthus and fried rice were ordered.They were delicious, especially the signature dishes.

Vimukthi Pieris ,The General Manager/Team leader and his staff were courteous and diligent...Saw to the needs of every customer, in personal way ...Sea view rooms with balcony and windows overlooking beach was very relaxing..Vimukthi and team did his best to make our holiday memorable and unforgettable....

The roof top lounge with a breathtaking view of the expanse of the sea and beach was absolutely stunning especially at Sunrise and sundown..Beach chairs are placed at the facing of the beach for reading and sunbathing ..Swimming overlooks the sea...

Well done...Class , comfort and Excellence at an affordable price.
A clean sprawling beach haven Proximate to Airport and colombo.
column13: Class , comfort and Excellence at an affordable price. A clean sprawling beach haven Proximate to Airport and colombo.

column12: We stayed here with a group.  The hotel itself is in a good location and the rooms were OK.  We ordered food on the rooftop terrace and waited around an hour and the food was awful - tiny tasteless portions.  Likewise for breakfast.  Good for backpacking, but avoid the food unless its improved.
column13: Hotel is nice but the food was very slow and awful

column10: No room service. Outside liquor not allowed. But everything is available at the hotel.
column12: Good location.Small hotel but nice and clean. Rooms are not very spacious but nice. Pool was quite small not very deep so it‚Äôs safe for kids. Food seemed to be little pricey with the taxes but tasty. Sundown bar at rooftop open from 5pm. No room service but they allow in room dining. The manager and the rest of the staff were very friendly. I booked for two nights on BB. Had an enjoyable, relaxed stay. Would recommend this place to anyone.

column12: Stayed here for a night before heading to the South Beaches. We got there late and the staff were very friendly, stayed up while we enjoyed a few beers and had our comfortable rooms all ready for us. In the morning a nice traditional Sri Lankan roti breakfast and we were on our way. Great place for a short stay, the rooms are clean and cosy, staff are very friendly and accommodating. I recommend this place especially if you‚Äôre in Negombo and checking out the fish markets for a day.

column6: {'id': '4323102', 'name': 'Hotel J Negombo', 'rating': 3.5, 'numberOfReviews': 747, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.232735, 'longitude': 79.84051, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d4323102-Reviews-Hotel_J_Negombo-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.hotelj.lk/negombo/', 'address': '331/1 Lewis Place Negombo Beach, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '331/1 Lewis Place', 'street2': 'Negombo Beach', 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 32, 'count2': 61, 'count3': 205, 'count4': 264, 'count5': 185}}
column10:
Air conditioning in the room.
Only a short transfer from Colombo airport.
Lots of tuk tuks available outside the hotel to visit local sights
column12: We cannot praise this hotel highly enough. Staff are absolutely lovely, so smiley and helpful. We arrived at the hotel early after a long flight, and within about 45 minutes they had sorted us our room so that we could go and have a sleep. The hotel is in a great location, right on the beach and within walking distance of all the bars and restaurants.  Money exchange place is also next door. Good breakfast, fresh fruit, a cooked breakfast with choice of eggs, and toast and jam, tea or coffee.  Also has a great roof top bar to watch the sun go down. Lovely gardens, with a pool and loungers - towels provided. Sadly I had an accident while in Negombo - the staff could not do enough for me. Nothing was too much trouble. We had to stay on an extra night until our return flights could be arranged, but they kept us in the same room and looked after us completely until the moment the taxi arrived.  I do not know the names of all of the staff, but from reception, maintenance, bar staff, breakfast staff and the Manager, they were all fantastic.  Thank you everyone for making our stay so enjoyable - we will definitely be back to continue our trip.

column12: As a group of 22, including 19 students, we were satisfied with our stay here. We arrived late to the hotel, but the staff at the hotel were prepared for our arrival and greeted us promptly. We arrived at around 4 am, so this was extremely helpful for us.

column10: Hotel J is good value for money.
column12: My friend Johanna and I discovered Hotel J by chance, when our friend Cees from Familyhouse recommended Hotel J. We stayed 10 days in our seaview room and we absolutely loved it. The staff were extremely helpful, very kind and caring. The food we ordered was always perfect. Our room was very clean, and anytime we asked for cleaning services they came straightaway. Our beds were very comfortable. The WiFi was very good. The garden was well kept and the swimming pool was well looked after. We would love to come back.
column13: Hotel J is the perfect place to have a wonderful holiday. We felt at home and well looked after.

column6: {'id': '4323102', 'name': 'Hotel J Negombo', 'rating': 3.5, 'numberOfReviews': 747, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.232735, 'longitude': 79.84051, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d4323102-Reviews-Hotel_J_Negombo-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.hotelj.lk/negombo/', 'address': '331/1 Lewis Place Negombo Beach, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '331/1 Lewis Place', 'street2': 'Negombo Beach', 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 32, 'count2': 61, 'count3': 205, 'count4': 264, 'count5': 185}}
column12: Arrived on 7th Jan 2024 for the second time in two months. Although, I have been staying at Hotel J since it's inception, I thought that it was appropriate to comment on my experience this time. Every morning I have been served breakfast by a senior staffer Roger Pate, who is extremely polite, courteous & professional in every sense. He has the knack of anticipating my needs which is an immense help in my decision making. I have always been nervous to use machine washed cutlery in hotels. To my great joy I saw Roger Pate meticulously wiping all the machine washed cutlery. That gave me the assurance of the very high standards of cleanliness maintained at hotel J. The general cleanliness of hotel floors & toilets are also second to none. Roger Pate's command of the English Language is also excellent as it is his first language. I strongly recommend that you ask for him by name.
column13: I have to thank the very amiable General Manager Vimukthi Peiris for my wonderful experiences & wish him every success.
